hints.content:
There are $\blueD{4}$ friends.

They got $\greenD{12}$ total carrots.

[[☃ image 1]]

What is the $\purpleC{\text{size of the groups}}$?

options.alt: A tape diagram with 2 tapes of equal lengths. The first tape is labeled 12 and the second tape with 4 equal parts each labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket across the bottom and the width of the second tape is labeled with the words 4 equal groups. !

hints.content:
We can write this as a multiplication problem. 

$\blueD{\text{ number of groups}}\times\purpleC{\text{size of the group}}= \greenD{\text{ total}}$

So, $\blueD{4}\times\purpleC{\text{?}} = \greenD{12}$

We can also write this as a division problem. 

$\greenD{\text{total}}\div\blueD{\text{ number of groups}}=\purpleC{\text{ size of the groups}}$

So, $\greenD{12}\div \blueD{4}=\purpleC{\text{?}}$

The equations that would help us find out how many carrots Rhonda Rabbit gave each friend are:  

 - $\blueD{4}\times\purpleC{\text{?}} = \greenD{12}$
 - $\greenD{12}\div \blueD{4}=\purpleC{\text{?}}$

question.content:
Rhonda Rabbit found $12$ carrots to give to her $4$ friends.  She gave each friend the same number of carrots. 

**Which equations would help us find out how many carrots Rhonda Rabbit gave to each friend?**

[[☃ radio 1]]
